com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.query

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.query.Query

  • public class Query
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    Represents a query that is sent to a data source.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Query()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abort()
      Stops the automated query sending that was started with setRefreshInterval().

      Sends the query to the data source.

      Sets the query to automatically call the send method every specified duration (number of seconds), starting from the first explicit call to send.

      Sets the number of seconds to wait for the data source to respond before raising a timeout error.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static final Query create(String dataSourceUrl)
        Constructor with data source.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceUrl - URL to send the query to.
        Returns:
        a new query opbject

      • create

        public static final Query create(String dataSourceUrl,
           QueryOptions options)
        Constructor with data source and options.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceUrl - URL to send the query to.
        options - A map of options for the request.
        Returns:
        a new query opbject

      • abort

        public final void abort()
        Stops the automated query sending that was started with setRefreshInterval().

      • send

        public final void send(QueryCallback queryCallback)
        Sends the query to the data source. callback should be a function that will be called when the data source responds.
        The callback function will receive a single parameter of type google.visualization.QueryResponse.
        Parameters:
        queryCallback -

      • setQuery

        public final void setQuery(String query)
        Sets the query string. The value of the string parameter should be a valid query. This method, if used, should be called before calling the send method.
        Learn more about the Query language.
        Parameters:
        query -

      • setRefreshInterval

        public final void setRefreshInterval(int refreshInterval)
        Sets the query to automatically call the send method every specified duration (number of seconds), starting from the first explicit call to send. seconds is a number greater than or equal to zero. Cancel this method either by calling it again with zero (the default), or by calling abort().
        Parameters:
        refreshInterval -

      • setTimeout

        public final void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the number of seconds to wait for the data source to respond before raising a timeout error. seconds is a number greater than zero.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the default timeout is 30 seconds.
